snippet: The new policy, which takes effect on Jan. 16, could pave the way for thousands of veterans to file claims.
abstract: Veterans Affairs Dept approves new regulations to make it easier for veterans to receive health care and compensation for certain illnesses that have been linked to traumatic brain injury.
lead_paragraph: The new policy, which takes effect on Jan. 16, could pave the way for thousands of veterans to file claims.

headline.main: New Rule Could Aid Veterans’ Access to Health Care for Some Traumatic Injuries
headline.print_headline: New Rule to Make it Easier for Veterans to Get Health Care for Some Traumatic Injuries
